title: Yummy!
text: Good salad and mains for sharing amongst friends. Service was sufficiently fast and always around. Reservations recommended if you have dinner late, otherwise 7pm was fine.

title: Famous Ancient Greece!
text: It was a great way to start our Greek holiday. An introduction to ancient Greece! Do remember to wear proper shoes with grip coz they have marble and/or stone that had been smoothen out by the millions of visitors to the site.

title: Interesting!
text: A good ending after walking the Acropolis (and Parthenon) to see the statues taken down from the structures. Each frescos tell a story!

title: Good hotel but pity about the location
text:
Location location location goes the saying...

Without a doubt a very nice hotel. Staff and their service were top notch. Rooms were nice furnished. Bathrooms were spotlessly clean. Free large bottle of water upon checkin. Breakfast spread was good and with a fantastic view! Equally fantastic views for the evening drinks (same area). Pool? Nah dun bother. Gym? It was ok.

Did you feel safe walking around there at night? Well... maybe... maybe not... Safer in numbers. Loads of graffiti and shops that are closed and boarded up. It was alright going for a morning run at sunrise (7:30am) around the area. But it was just the evening walk back from Plaka and other dining areas that kinda bothered us a bit. Staying here would require you to walk some distance to the various sites or faster by train or taxi. Otherwise a good hotel!

title: Perfect pit stop in Heraklion Crete
text: Restful place in front of the fountain with parison style seating. They have 2 types of Bougatsa - sweet with cream or savory with cheese.

title: Good and different unagi restaurant
text: I'm not normally a unagi person, but their eel is definitely different from all the other restaurants. Definitely recommended to anyone who doesn't normally have unagi. Place is small though, so either go there really early or late.

title: Great and satisfying brunch!
text: They have a wide spread brunch menu ranging from the usual eggs etc. But you really should try their buckwheat pancakes! And their beef & quinoa salad! Don't miss out!
place: The Populus Coffee and Food Co

title: Friendly service, good food and great coffee!
text:
Went for brunch and the friendly service manager, Marc, served us promptly.

This is actually the second time that I'd been to The Lokal, and once again the food and coffee did not disappoint. Today's brunch: Very good portion of ham and nicely melted cheese in their toastie.

Recommended to anyone for brunch, and lunch. Not sure if they have a dinner menu though.

title: Sounds like good value but....
text:
Always good to start here on the first day of a visit to Barcelona before you try out all the others. That way you’ll have a comparison between the so-so and the good and the really good.
But if you have limited time, don’t bother.

title: Fun tapas place in a modern setting
text: Probably the best I’ve had on this trip! Food & wine selection were tops! Although it’s in a modern pub setting.

title: Great location but bathroom an issue
text:
Location of this apart’otel is excellent with several attractions like the Gaudi designed Casas, the Palau de la Musica and plenty of shopping all around and lastly a smorgasbord of food & drink surrounding Citadines.

The down side: shower walls were surprisingly dirty and a neurotic hot/cold water shower plus the water seemed to be trickling most times.

Luckily for us the staff were all friendly and helpful. The room itself was very good - space wise, kitchenette facilities were very good, clean (except for shower wall).

title: Nice hotel perched on top of the hills of Sapa town
text:
Stayed at this hotel as part of a package for the Vietnam Mountain Marathon 2018. It was one of the few hotels sitting on the top of the hilly Sapa town. The whole entire region is hilly. The Sapa town centre, restaurants and shops are all in the Sapa town valley. This hotel is on the top of the hill, and therefore it meant walking down and back up every time you are leaving the hotel. However, the view from the hotel was amazing! The morning air fresh and crisp. Hotel staff were helpful.

Hotel room was spacious especially since I was running in the event which meant that I could spread out my gear etc. Bathroom was also very spacious! Further plus points!

Recommended for its spaciousness and clean rooms & hotel environment as well as the views.

title: Decent hotel in a great location
text: Really decent hotel situated in a great location within the Old Quarter area. Hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. They gave great suggestions for F&B, and was able to size us up to explain what to expect at the various shops. Roughly 30min to the airport (leaving the hotel at 4pm). Recommended!

title: Good food and excellent milkshakes!
text: Good value place to grab a bite. I especially loved their rueben sandwich and excellent milkshake! Don't tell too many people! It might get overly crowded and you wouldn't be able to get sitted.

title: Good place to get away for a drink
text: Nice, quiet, discreet place for a drink with friends or work discussions etc.. It's not cheap but you pay for the ambience and the location. Service was top notch!

title: Good food with good service
text: Many restaurants nowadays offer good food but this place paired it well with great service. Close attention always but never in your face. More importantly it wasn't one of those noisy Chinese restaurants, so one could actually hear each other talk without all that background chatter etc.

title: Good experience. Recommended.
text: Went there recently for a celebration and the restaurant had a nice touch to give us a complimentary dessert. Do note that it is fairly casual so it’s not required to be too dressed up, so even jeans & polo is fine.

title: Convenient location. Good service with quick food.
text: Service was quick and timely. Food came very quickly. Although mains came before the appetiser. Nonetheless, the appetiser was so small that it didn't matter. Perhaps the appetiser ought to be a larger portion! Mains tasted great and looked good too.

title: Hit & miss food. Service lacking.
text: We had a birthday lunch celebration on a Sunday and their service was somewhat lacking. Perhaps they had some staff away?? Nevertheless, service staff were slow to at least acknowledge us before taking our food orders. Their dishes used to be very good, but after this lunch, we reckon that while several were still nice but some were misses.

title: Casual hangout for lunch & dinner
text: Came here for my birthday recently for a late lunch on a Saturday and it was quiet upstairs in the restaurant. Food was excellent - we had the steak frites (chef willingly changed the fries for a salad) and their burger - with both done very nicely. Drinks were equally good - various drinks on tap and I don't just mean beer. They definitely stay out from the crowd in terms of their drinks. Thumbs up!

title: Attractively priced hotel
text:
Stayed for 5 nights in this busy shopping belt of Seoul. Sejong is situated at the opposite end of Myeongdong from Lotte Department Store & Hotel. So you're gonna have to lug all your Lotte shopping & duty-free shopping from Lotte back! Although it's very close to the rest of the Myeongdong shopping & dining area.
The concierge is very good & helpful with suggestions and alternatives. Service is prompt and the rooms are clean and in good condition although the hotel does look a little dated.
Sejong and neighboring hotels are one of the last hotel stops along the airport bus loop though so taxi may be a more viable option if you are time-starved and not too budget conscious.

title: Good range of beers
text: Great place for after office drinks and catching up with friends over a few beers. Quite a wide variety of beer available. Their hi-tables were a little cramped for space for food and drinks. Regular tables which were for large groups looked ok.

title: Good physiotherapy & sports massage
text:
Visited them twice in one trip and then again in my next trip to BKK. Yes, they're good - well-trained, professional, clean, and most importantly of all they know their stuff.

I had 3 types of sessions - regular physiotherapy with ultrasound treatment of Achilles heel and a sore big toe; sports massage (aka deep tissue massage); and Muscle Activation Therapy (MAT). Each session was completed with a specialist in their own field.

Recommended for all sports enthusiasts for treatment of their aches & pains.

title: Well priced fully serviced aparthotel
text: Centre Point Chidlom is a fairly well priced apartment-hotel. Proximity to restaurants for breakfast & other main meals within minutes of the hotel. In-house tuk tuk service to the Chidlom BTS as well as Central Embassy and Central Chidlom as well as surrounding areas. However, you could easily walk it, to places like Central (all 3 of them) and Amarin Plaza / Hyatt Hotel / 4-faced Buddha.

title: Convenient restaurant on Lang Suan Rd
text: Had dinner there twice and found that the western menu items were pretty good. Better than the Asian menu. Convenient and nice for a change if you're staying on Lang Suan Rd.

title: Nice crepes
text: Nice crepes here! Supposedly authentic too. Although portions wouldn't be sufficient for those with large appetites. Nicely located along Lang Suan Rd. Breakfast available from 8am.

title: Nice park to go for a run around
text: Nice park to get your mileage in or to get some running done to work off all the food and drink. Quite a few drink stalls around the route too. Decent location with quite a few hotels surrounding it within running distance.

title: Very well located at Ploenchit BTS
text: Décor is modern and chic. This hotel obviously had been renovated. Good gym and very nice pool though a little small. This Novotel is directly below the Ploenchit BTS. Nice breakfast café next door if you didn't opt for breakfast in the hotel. Restaurants for dinner close by down the laneway.

title: Love their food!
text: Compliments to the chef! Love all their food items at this restaurant. Been here a number of times and never had any problems or complaints. Food as well as service staff are good - across all their various outlets!

title: Coffee and breakfast - excellent!
text: Very good for their food and coffee and well priced too. Right next door to Novotel Ploenchit. Immediately below the BTS.

title: Very good location
text:
One of the few impressive large hotel that you'll see in the Tenjin area. Size of their deluxe room was large for this standard of hotel in Japan; provision of Shesido shower gels etc was a nice touch. Good service staff from bellhop to room service and front desk. Security going up to the rooms was surprisingly absent.
Location: great! Walking distance to restaurants, to subway, airport bus & train, and Ohori Park.

title: Add this to your running route if you're in the area
text: Go only if you've never been on the grounds of a castle in Japan. You're not going to see anything else except for walls of the ruins of a castle. Only good if you're in need of a running path.

title: Good insight into Fukuoka
text: The museum provided a good insight into Fukuoka. Only 1 main exhibition hall worth seeing. The other hall had everything in Japanese so it was more of a viewing gallery. Unfortunately there's no near by subway.

title: Decent hotel close to everything
text:
Though it was located around the quieter part of Tenjin it really wasn't too far from everything like subway, restaurants, shopping malls, yatais, etc. Literally around the corner from famous Shin Shin restaurant. Convenience stores such as Lawsons and Family Mart around the corner.
Rooms were expectedly small, functional, and served its purpose.

title: Matcha Kakigori (or Uji Kintoki) @ Kamiya Seika, Fukuoka
text: Very good pure strong green tea taste in their kakigori! And their Japanese sweets from this 300-year shop was equally impressive where it wasn't overly sweet but the flavour of the ingredients were allowed to stand out.

title: Flank Steak & Pork Lion
text:
While the flank steak was tasty it was a bit on the tough side. Quite disappointing and surprised that it wasn't cooked better.
The pork lion on the other hand was superbly done! Worth it!

title: Good food. Good drink. What else is there for?
text: Went there with friends to celebrate a birthday. Choose this place if you have had or in need of an introduction to Eastern Europe food, drinks, and culture!

title: Good CKT with duck eggs!
text:
Ok, so you've had char kuay teow before, and you've had it all over Singapore and Malaysia even in different places in Penang - But have you had THIS version?!

Not too salty, not too oily either, but the addition of duck eggs did leng it a nice flavour to it compared to the regular chicken egg.

title: Modern & Good Location
text: If you've been to Penang before and have done the heritage refurbished stay within the UNESCO city of Georgetown already then perhaps on your next visit to Penang, you could consider staying with the G Hotel Kelawai. It's close by to many of the famous eating areas, like Lorong Selamat, Jalan Burma's coffeeshops, and a 10-15min drive to Jalan Penang. Of course, in the cool of the evening, you could stroll about 15min over to the Perut Rumah Nyona Restaurant which is just down Jalan Kelawei. Fancy a little bit of shopping? It's just a stone's throw away behind the hotel. Best thing is that you wouldn't be caught in the traffic jam along Gurney Drive ever. And after ALL that eating/feasting, the G Hotel Kelawai has a well-equipped spacious gym to work off your ckt and chendols. The pool did look inviting but unfortunately there just wasn't enough time for that.

title: Afternoon break with coffee and cake
text: After walking and exploring the UNESCO heritage site and photos with the street art, China House was a great place to relax and recharge.
